review_title: Not a very good place as it sounds to be from oustide
job_title: Senior Member of Technical Staff in Bangalore
pros: The Brand - If you ready to sacrifice your career for Oracle Brand, you are welcome.
cons:
1. Team does not care about what you have worked in past, just they assign and make you work on the technologies which ever management want.
2. Non revenue generation team does not get hike and bonus as they are not generating revenues as per managers.
3. Be ready to stagnant your career in Oracle, no technical work, no hike, no bonus, no onsite visit.
4. Work from home option given to favorite persons year on year and that too with knowledge to senior management.
5. Biased and non transparent hike to favorite persons.
6. Some times, you have to do your manager's kid programming and manager can say "finally you got some work in your field".
7. There is nothing called HR process in Oracle and managers are all in all.
8. People have to get offers from outside to get hike and bonus only if management thinks that they are needed at that point of time.
9. You can not go for any professional training out of your interest inside Oracle (Oracle University classes), only that training depends on your manager.
10. Senior managers (VP/AVP/Senior Directors) visits India and notes down few points/feedback just for filling up the notebooks. No action taken on same.
11. If you are favorite to your manager, you can get hike, bonus and work from options for more than 3 years in a row.
12. Close relatives can work in same team and one being the manager to the team.

pros: Modern Block B office with good facilities (although an extra canteen is needed).  Good benefits - can buy extra holidays and upgrade health insurance. Plenty of career opportunities. If you get lucky with your product and territory you can have a very nice experience. Good work/life balance.
cons:
There are big problems structurally. I came here expecting to be in a top sales job working for one of the biggest companies in the world. What I found was a start-up environment where I was required to do cold-calling day in, day out, which is the task of a Business Development Rep, not an experienced seller. 

The fact that Sales Reps and BD Reps are doing the same job means we are practically working against each other - structure! Field reps get paid when you are successful but not the other way around. The SMB and Subsidiary situation also doesn't work. To top it all of much of the management like micro-manage which make everything that bit more unpleasant.

Several hundred people have been taken on recently and many were suddenly told that they don't have a team anymore, go an look for another. Who mass employs people without a plan?

From day one you are told how it's a self-service organisation. They're not kidding! You have to sort everything yourself. Of course some people may prefer this, depending on the individual.

review_title: A mixed bag of pros and cons
pros:
- Good work life balance.
- Flexibility of working from home.
- Very easy to switch projects and bussiness units.
- Encouragement for learners and certification seekers.

Very important point is above pros are applicable if your manager has willingness towards them. Very frequently it happens that teams that are in Oracle brings their old company's culture which prevails in Oracle as well. The understanding of values many a times conflicts with values of Oracle.
cons:
that's a big list now
- Very laid back attitude of mid management.
- Too many shuffles in management level.
- No HR mechanism to address employee's concern. Manager is almighty.
- Very poor and less frequent appraisals. CTC is increased once in 2 or 3 years.
- Still works and carry on working on legacy technologies.
People who are looking for a relaxed and laid back work culture can  and should join.

job_title: Field Sales Manager in Chicago, IL
pros: I spent nine years there; financially they're stable, and I was able to close some huge deals.  Some great people.  In the early days it was fun; if you closed a deal you got paid on the 15th of the next month and they were very lucrative commissions.   You can also move around quite a bit, get a variety of experiences.
cons:
Bureaucracy can be brutal.  They limit (cap) sales commissions and the comp plans are not what they used to be.  Territories are very unequal.  So much depends on whether or not your manager likes you and what accounts you get.  Products need to be updated faster.

Lots of dog-eat-dog among the reps and managers.  Larry pits teams against each other.  I felt more fearful of internal teams than of my competition.  It is a very mean-spirited culture in sales there.  I was one of the top reps yet I hated it the internal fighting.  At Oracle, you have to stand your ground and a lot of people won't like you if you do.  People expect to be able to run over you and if you don't let them they diss you.  Also, a lot of difficulties getting paid due to multiple people getting paid on a deal and a log time to get paid after a deal.

pros:

cons:

Few growth opportunities.

review_title: Flexible and Comfortable Retirement Home for Engineers
pros: Great benefits. Great location in Nashua NH where you avoid the Boston traffic and the Massachusetts income tax if you live in New Hampshire. Very flexible environment. You can work from home whenever you need to. There's not much stress, at least not in my team. You can move around to other groups if you want to work on something different.
cons:
Raises are non-existent from my experience. You can go years without a single raise, and if you do get one, it's a very small one. From what I hear, promotions are hard to get also. If you apply for an internal job, it is company policy that you cannot get a raise or a promotion (title change), so all moves within the company are lateral.

Oracle is just not a fun and exciting company to work for. If you are looking for an exciting environment where you can advance in your career, this isn't the place for you. Not many young people work here, and there's a good reason for that. If you are looking for a place that is comfortable and flexible and you value that way more than money, career advancement and a fun culture, this may be the place for you.
